text: Edward Davis "Ed" Wood, Jr. (October 10, 1924 â€“ December 10, 1978) was an American director, producer, screenwriter, actor, author, and editor who is known for his works in low-budget horror or fantasy movies and is also known for his works with Bela Lugosi. Wood is considered one of the worst movie directors of all time. His most famous were Plan 9 from Outer Space, Bride of the Monster and Glen or Glenda. Wood was born in Poughkeepsie, New York on October 10, 1924. At a young age, because his mother had wanted a girl, he was forced to dress up as a girl and would have that crossdressing habit for the rest of his life. Wood had a lifelong attraction to the feel of angora. Wood was married to Norma McCarty in 1956 until they divorced several months later. Then he married Kathy O'Hara in 1956. They were married until his death in 1978. Wood had an illigitimate daughter from a 1946 relationship who lived in NY. Wood died on December 10, 1978 in Los Angeles, California from a heart attack, aged 54. A 1994 movie was released based on Wood's life directed by Tim Burton. Johnny Depp played Wood in the movie. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1924 births Category:1978 deaths Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:American movie actors Category:American movie editors Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Movie directors from New York (state) Category:Movie producers from New York (state) Category:Screenwriters from New York (state) Category:People from Poughkeepsie, New York
title: Ed Wood
